channel.title: microwatt on VHDL News
channel.description: Recent content in microwatt on VHDL News

item.title: Microwatt and GHDL - An Open Hardware CPU written in VHDL, Synthesized with Open Source Tools
item.description: Microwatt and GHDL - An Open Hardware CPU written in VHDL, Synthesized with Open Source Tools Speakers: Anton Blanchard, IBM & Tristan Gingold, CERN Microwatt is a 64 bit POWER OpenISA soft processor, written in VHDL. Over time it has grown from supporting Micropython, to Zephyr and most recently Linux. From its original inception, Microwatt has relied heavily on GHDL, the Open Source VHDL simulator. GHDL has very recently added synthesis support and together with Yosys and Nextpnr allows for a completely open source toolchain for FPGAs.

GHDL has very recently added synthesis support and together with Yosys and Nextpnr allows for a completely open source toolchain for FPGAs.
